title: Relates to personal watercraft and certain safety provisions that require their use
summary: Allows personal watercraft to be used as an alternative to a surfboat.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

           S. 1457                                                  A. 1410

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                             S E N A T E - A S S E M B L Y

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       IN SENATE -- Introduced by Sen. LAVALLE -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Health

       IN  ASSEMBLY  -- Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation  to  personal  water-
         craft  and  certain  safety  provisions that require their use; and to
         amend the navigation law, in relation to making technical  corrections
         thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (a) of subdivision  2  of  section  1341  of  the
    2  public health law is amended to read as follows:
    3    (a) Every person maintaining any such bathing establishment shall also
    4  keep  and  provide  in connection therewith, for the facilitating of the
    5  rescue of persons in danger of drowning, a surfboat OR A PERSONAL WATER-
    6  CRAFT AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION THIRTY OF SECTION TWO OF THE  NAVIGATION
    7  LAW.  A  SURFBOAT SHALL BE not less than sixteen feet long, on each side
    8  of which there shall be hanging ropes arranged so that  persons  in  the
    9  water can easily catch hold of same, or be supported thereby. Such boats
   10  shall be equipped with two or more sets of oars and life-lines and life-
   11  belts,  and  at least one ring buoy or life preserver, with quarter-inch
   12  cotton line, not less than five hundred feet in  length,  with  suitable
   13  reel  attached  thereto. In addition thereto, there shall be anchored on
   14  the shore, a suitable reel with a half-inch cotton line  not  less  than
   15  five  hundred feet in length, with a life-belt attached thereto, kept in
   16  good order and proper condition, so that it can readily be used by those
   17  assisting in saving life.
   18    S 2. Subdivision 30 of section 2 of the navigation law,  as  added  by
   19  chapter 830 of the laws of 1990, is renumbered subdivision 30-a.
   20    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03872-01-1
